column4: recommended graphical FTP client anyone? I am using regular old ubuntu 9.10 w/gnome.
nautilus works for sftp, too. some use gftp

In nautilus (the File Manager), choose File: Connect to Server. It works pretty good, and it mounts the remote filesystem so all your apps can edit remote files, too. (You don't have to copy files over to work with them.)
In fact, the nautilus sftp is good enough that I haven't installed a separate ftp program on my current installation of Ubuntu.
